meanings.sent1: The ching of the bell echoed through the quiet room.
meanings.sent2: I heard a ching coming from the wind chimes outside.
meanings.sent3: The ching of the alarm clock woke me up with a start.
meanings.sent4: The ching of the metal against metal was like music to his ears.
meanings.sent5: The ching of the glass breaking made everyone jump in surprise.

meanings.sent1: He made a ching from his successful business venture.
meanings.sent2: She saved up quite a ching from her part-time job.
meanings.sent3: Finding a bag full of ching on the street would be a dream come true!
meanings.sent4: His eyes gleamed at the sight of the shiny ching in the briefcase.
meanings.sent5: The ching in his pocket made him feel like a wealthy man.

meanings.definition: To make a high-pitched ringing sound
meanings.sent1: The teapot began to ching as the water inside boiled.
meanings.sent2: The metal wires ching when you run your fingers along them.
meanings.sent3: The old door chinged loudly every time it was opened.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter chinged like bells in the crisp winter air.
meanings.sent5: The wind chinged through the trees, creating a soothing melody.

meanings.definition: To hit or strike something with force
meanings.sent1: He chinged the hammer against the nail to secure it in place.
meanings.sent2: The boxer chinged his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally chinged her elbow on the corner of the table.
meanings.sent4: The waves chinged against the rocks, creating a rhythmic sound.
meanings.sent5: The knight chinged his sword against his shield before battle.
